result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber L Bernicky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to cost.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: victims Paul and Cheryl W. or their residences.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions (to include treatment and child care).  Sentence to commence by 5:00 p.m. on 10/14/16 - LAST 60 days STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber L Bernicky in court with Attorney Chris Bailey.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Court will proceed today without presentence investigation as parties all agree to same.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Paul W. makes statements.  Attorney Bailey makes statements regarding sentencing.  Kim D.N. makes statements.   Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:   

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION: 5 YEARS  (10 days credit, if revoked) 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims Paul and Cheryl W. or their residences 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($250.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  140 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions (to include treatment and child care) to commence by 5:00 p.m. on 10/14/16 -last 60 Days STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion   

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated 09/22/16, from Agent Sharp, giving notice that a PSI cannot be completed with the information she has available.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.

(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Bailey to Judge Carter, giving notice that the PSI is completed without the Defenant's interview, and requests a rescheduled hearing or that the hearing be cancelled. Sent to Judge Carter for review.
09/08/16, hearing set for 09/08/16 was taken off.
Review hearing on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Dated 08/24/16, from Agent Karen Sharp to Judge Carter, giving notice that she has not been able to contact the Defendant to conduct the PSI.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
08/29, review hearing to be set.
Sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
